page.title: 07THE NEEDLES BATTERY
page.content:
The Needles Battery is on the western point of the island overlooking the Needles lighthouse.The Needles Battery was built in 1861-63,250ft above sea level.The Battery which cost Â£6,958, was designed by Major James Edwards, Royal Engineers,and built by George Smith of Pimlico, London .Mr.Smith did not begin work until September 1861 by which time he should have completed a third of the contract.In 1893 the new Needles Battery was built at the top of the ridge,where the original Needles lighthouse had stood until 1859. The chalk of the Needles had proved too unstable to withstand the concussion of the new guns being installed to replace the old 9in.
